com.javierorbe.math

Class Matrix

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.javierorbe.math.Matrix

  • public class Matrix
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a mathematical matrix.
    See Also:
    Matrix (mathematics) in Wikipedia

      • multiply

        public void multiply(Matrix matrix)
        Hadamard product. Multiply each element in this matrix with the element in the same position in the given matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix that will multiply this matrix.
        Throws:
        InvalidMatrixException - if the matrices are not the same size.
        See Also:
        Hadamard product in Wikipedia

      • multiply

        public static Matrix multiply(Matrix a,
                              Matrix b)
        Returns the result matrix of multiplying two matrices. The resultant matrix has the same number of rows as the first operand matrix and the same number of columns as the second operand matrix. The order of multiplication matters. The number of columns in the first matrix must equal the number of rows in the second matrix.
        Parameters:
        a - the first matrix in the multiplication.
        b - the second matrix in the multiplication.
        Returns:
        the result of the multiplication.
        Throws:
        InvalidMatrixException - if the number of columns in the first matrix doesn't equal the number of rows in the second matrix.

      • transpose

        public static Matrix transpose(Matrix matrix)
        Returns the transpose of a matrix.
        Parameters:
        matrix - the matrix to transpose.
        Returns:
        the transposed matrix.
        See Also:
        Transpose in Wikipedia

      • isSquare

        public boolean isSquare()
        Returns true if the matrix is square. If the row count equals the column count, a matrix is square.
        Returns:
        true if the matrix is square, otherwise false.

      • isIdentity

        public boolean isIdentity()
        Returns true if this matrix is an identity matrix.
        Returns:
        true if this matrix is an identity matrix, otherwise false.
        Throws:
        InvalidMatrixException - if the matrix is not square.

      • subtractRow

        public void subtractRow(int row1,
                        int row2,
                        double scalar)
        Subtract to a row another row multiplied by a scalar. row1' = row1 - (scalar * row2)
        Parameters:
        row1 - The affected row.
        row2 - The row to subtract.
        scalar - The scalar that multiplies the second row.

      • subtractColumn

        public void subtractColumn(int col1,
                           int col2,
                           double scalar)
        Subtract to a column another column multiplied by a scalar. col1' = col1 - (scalar * col2)
        Parameters:
        col1 - The affected column.
        col2 - The column to subtract.
        scalar - The scalar that multiplies the second column.

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object o)
        Compares the specified object with this matrix for equality. Returns true if and only if the specified object is also a matrix, both matrices have the save size, and all corresponding elements in the two matrices are equal.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object
        Parameters:
        o - the object to be compared for equality with this matrix.
        Returns:
